str2: Remembrance, recollection, putting in mind; a reminder. From hupomimnesko; a reminding or recollection.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Unfeigned, without hypocrisy, sincere. Undissembled, i.e. Sincere.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To dwell in, be settled (stationary) in; met: To be indwelling. From en and oikeo; to inhabit.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A grandmother. Of natural origin; a grandmother.
Lois, grandmother of Timothy. Of uncertain origin; Lois, a Christian woman.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
Eunice, mother of Timothy. From eu and nike; victorious; Eunice, a Jewess.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
